title: What is the history of the study of somnambulism and its relation to hypnotism?
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens of this text, the author discusses the phenomenon of lucidity in somnambulism and the challenges involved in producing it in public. The author argues that attempts to produce lucidity are likely to fail and even if successful, the credibility of the experiment is questionable due to the tendency of somnambulists to deceive. Prior to this, the author examines the history and development of somnambulism and its relationship to hypnosis, as well as the work of prominent researchers like Dr. Liébeault and Dr. Charcot. The author also addresses common misconceptions about somnambulism and emphasizes the need for rigorous scientific study to uncover its secrets.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while it is generally agreed that consent is necessary for hypnosis to occur, there are exceptions to this rule. As the author has observed, those who have already been hypnotized may be susceptible to hypnosis again, even if they initially resist. However, there are ways to protect against this risk, such as suggesting an absolute ban on hypnosis or limiting the individuals who are allowed to perform it. It is important to view hypnosis not only scientifically but also socially, acknowledging its potential power and the need for caution when practicing and studying it.
